subject: Standard Operating Procedure (SOP)/ Guidelines for approval of Capacity Augmentation; Road Safety and Strengthening/ Overlay Works
text: #Ra 7 @THf uferazrut (Tsm 9Rde7 &1 <TAN T4, IG TRoR) National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, Government of India) Frqa Ja #i-5 &a 6, "acr-10, ERAI, 78f @crf}t 110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka_ New Delhi-110075 T9/Phone 91-11-25074100 25074200 NHAI /Policy Guidelines /Road Safety /2025 Policy Circular No.12.37/ 2025 dated 12th February, 2025 {Decision taken on E-Office File No. NHAI_ CMD/DOP/2022 (Comp. No. 152962)} Sub: Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) Guidelines for approval of  Capacity Augmentation, Road Safety and Strengthening/ Overlay Works reg: NHAI through Policy Circular No. 12.25/2022 dated 12.04.2022 Delegated Powers to Regional Officers (ROs) for approving estimates related to the rectification of MoRTH notified Blackspots through Long Term Measures up to an amount of Rs. 50 Cr. per Blackspot: For such works exceeding Rs. 50 Cr., approval from the concerned Member with the concurrence of Member (F) is required: Further, NHAI vide Policy Circular No_ 12.31/2023 dated 23.02.2023 permits ROs to combine bids for the rectification of MoRTH notified Blackspots into a single bid where feasible instead of inviting separate bids for each Blackspot: 2 It has been observed that several Projects require Capacity Augmentation which may include: Construction of Vehicular Underpasses (VUP), Flyovers, Service Roads, and Improvements to Structures & Bridges Rectification Works for Blackspots not notified by MoRTH through Long-Term Measures may also be necessary. Such works are typically required   during the DLP/O&M  Stage of Projects under EPC / HAN/TOT/BOT(T) Contracts. (ii) Strengthening & Overlay Works, based on Road Condition Assessments using methods of Network Survey Vehicle (NSV), FWD test etc. (iii) Works that need to be undertaken by NHAI as identified while inviting TOT / Invit Bids and agreed by PATSC/ EC. 3_ To streamline the Appraisal and Approval Process for these works, the following SOP / Guidelines have been formulated as per the decision taken in the EC Meeting (Agenda Item No. 650.04) held on 24.01.2025: (i) Appraisal and Approval Process: Amount of Project Proposal Level of Appraisal Level of Approval Upto Rs. 500 Cr. IAC Chairman, NHAI More than Rs. 500 Cr. PATSC Executive Committee, NHAI (ii) The Costs associated with such Capacity Augmentation, Road Safety , and Strengthening/ Overlay Works will be categorized under O&M expenses of developed sections.
